title: It's Time For Apple Watch
teaser: KQED's Rachael Myrow explains who the Apple Watch is geared to and why it will have a huge impact on the smart watch market.
contentencoded:
Apple is launching its first new product since 2010 at a press event in San Francisco today. The Apple Watch marks the company’s entry into wearables. The smart watch will start at $350, but different styles are expected to cost thousands of dollars.

KQED’s Rachael Myrow tells Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson about who the Apple Watch will be geared to and why Apple’s entry into the smart watch market will have a huge impact.

Guest

  • Rachael Myrow, Silicon Valley correspondent in KQED’s San Jose Bureau. She tweets @rachaelmyrow.
